description.raw:
Technically, this PR doesn't do anything to directly remove boost.  However, it does fix up a number of problems I encountered while trying to remove boost, so I collected them under the same umbrella.  Note that this should resolve #77 as well.

* Start branch remove-boost-7.

* Minor style cleanup.

* Fix up the provide_feedback test to be correct.

    As mentioned in issue #77, this test is actually not doing
    much at the moment, mostly because the links don't have
    inertia.  However, nobody ever noticed this fact because
    the test itself was too weak.  Take the proposed patch
    from issue #77, apply it, and then fix up the URDF so
    that we actually test the correct thing.

* Fix cfm damping integration test for URDF.

    Must like for provide_feedback, make sure we are actually
    parsing things properly inside the test, and then fix the
    URDF to have inertial for the link so we hit those tests.

* Update force_torque_sensor integration test to test for joints.

    Just add an extra test to ensure we are seeing all of the joints,
    which we happen to be for this test.

* Change a number of EXPECT_TRUE to ASSERT_TRUE in SDF_TEST.cc

    That way the test won't crash if they somehow become untrue.

* Put all of the parse_urdf.cc functions into the sdf namespace.

* Replace all uses of NULL with nullptr.
